etymology.description: 辵(辵) (chuò, "walk") + phonetic 㒸 (suì) = semantic for movement + phonetic value -> comply
etymology.interpretation: In the character 遂(遂), 辵(辵) (chuò, "walk") signifies movement, while 㒸 provides the sound. Together, it conveys the idea of going along with or complying.

examples.chinese: 他接到命令后(他接到命令後)，遂立刻出发(遂立刻出發)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiēdào mìnglìng hòu, suì lìkè chūfā.
examples.english: After receiving the command, he complied and set off immediately.

examples.chinese: 他遂遵从安排(他遂遵從安排)。
长官发布指令后(長官發布指令後)，士兵遂迅速集合(士兵遂迅速集合)。
examples.pinyin: Zhǎngguān fābù zhǐlìng hòu, shìbīng suì xùnsù jíhé.
examples.english: After the superior issued the command, the soldiers complied and assembled quickly.
